label: reg_hospital_id
name: hid
description: Centre identifier
source: Project Officer

label: patient_id
name: pid
description: Patient study identifier
source: Project Officer
coding_instructions: Enter the participant's study ID. This should be an unique number.

label: local_patient_id
name: filenumber
description: The hospital specific record identification number
source: Hospital record
coding_instructions: Only entered on paper format. Collect as many as possible

label: clinic_id
name: cid
description: Identifyer for the clinic registrating the data
source: Project Officer

label: referral status
name: refstat
description: Indicates whether the patient was transferred from another health facility
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: ref_hospital_code
name: rhc
description: Indicates the type of facility the patient was transferred/referred from
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: pt_age
name: age
description: The participant's age at the time of injury
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: pt_gender
name: gender
description: The participant's sex
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: moi
name: moi
description: The mechanism of injury
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record
coding_instructions: Should be coded according to ICD-10, chapter XX, block V01-Y36, excluding codes listed in appendix 1 of the data dictionary. Use the online search engine http://apps.who.int/classifications/icd10/browse/2016/en#/XX. In participants for whom a traumatic mechanism is highly probable but you are unable to establish the exact mechanism at first contact, for example if the participant arrives unconscious with obvious external signs of trauma but no one is around to confirm the mechanism, enroll and attempt to confirm mechanism later.

label: dominating_injury_type
name: dit
description: Indicates the type of injury that the patient has sustained
source: As provided by treating physician
coding_instructions: Ask the treating physician. If not available code 999

label: trauma_team_activation
name: tta
description: Indicates whether the trauma team was activated for the patient upon arrival at the hospital
source: Project Officer

label: arrival_by
name: ab
description: The mode of transport used by the participant to reach hospital
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: type_of_ems_service
name: toemss
description: Indicates the type of EMS service the patient arrived in
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record

label: ems_need_of_vent
name: emsnov
description: Indicates the need for assisted breathing in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. EMS Record 2. Participant 3. Participant relative/representative 4. Other person present who claim to know the participant 5. Hospital record

label: ems_hr
name: emshr
description: The heart rate recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records
logic_prompts: "Respiratory rate is higher than heart rate, are you sure this is correct?","Respiratory rate is higher than heart rate, are you sure this is correct?"

label: ems_sbp
name: emssbp
description: The systolic blood pressure recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records

label: ems_dbp
name: emsdbp
description: The diastolic blood pressure recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records
logic_prompts: "Diastolic blood pressure cannot be higher than systolic blood pressure","Diastolic blood pressure cannot be higher than systolic blood pressure"

label: ems_gcs
name: emsgcs
description: The Glasgow Comma Scale score recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records
coding_instructions: If not testable, for example because the participant is paralysed, use the code 99. For further details see the attached GCS assessment aid. If not available code as 999 (note that this code should only be used under exceptional circumstances and if used has to be discussed with the core team). For further details see the attached GCS assessment aid.

label: ems_avpu
name: emsavpu
description: Level of consciousness according to AVPU recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records

label: ems_rr
name: emsrr
description: The respiratory rate recorded by the EMS doctor in the pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records

label: ems_sat
name: emssat
description: The blood oxygen saturation recorded by the EMS doctor in a pre-hospital setting
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records
logic_prompts: "Blood oxygen saturation is quite high despite a low respiratory rate. Are you sure this is correct?","Blood oxygen saturation is quite high despite a low respiratory rate. Are you sure this is correct?"

label: ems_shock_index
name: emssi
description: Heart Rate divided by Systolic Blood Pressure recorded in the EMS
source: 1. Hospital record . EMS records

label: ed_need_of_vent
name: ednov
description: Indicates the need for assisted breathing in the ED
source: Project Officer

label: ed_hr
name: edhr
description: The first heart heart rate recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Recorded by project officer using an automatic peripheral pulse oximeter 2. Manually recorded by counting the patients heart rate during one minute 3. Monitor (only if option 1 and 2 are not possible due to interfering factors such as intravenous lines, other attached equipment)
logic_prompts: "Respiratory rate is higher than heart rate, are you sure this is correct?","Respiratory rate is higher than heart rate, are you sure this is correct?"

label: ed_sbp
name: edsbp
description: The first systolic blood pressure recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Recorded by project officer using an automatic blood pressure recorder in the left arm 2. Right arm 3. Monitor (only if option 1 and 2 are not possible due to interfering factors such as intravenous lines, other attached equipment)

label: ed_dbp
name: eddbp
description: The first diastolic blood pressure recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Recorded by project officer using an automatic blood pressure recorder in the left arm 2. Right arm 3. Monitor (only if option 1 and 2 are not possible due to interfering factors such as intravenous lines, other attached equipment)
logic_prompts: "Diastolic blood pressure cannot be higher than systolic blood pressure","Diastolic blood pressure cannot be higher than systolic blood pressure"

label: ed_gcs
name: edgcs
description: The first GCS score recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: Recorded by project officer using the GCS assessment aid.
coding_instructions: If not testable, for example because the participant is paralysed, use the code 99. For further details see the attached GCS assessment aid. If not available code as 999 (note that this code should only be used under exceptional circumstances and if used has to be discussed with the core team). For further details see the attached GCS assessment aid.

label: ed_rr
name: edrr
description: The first respiratory rate recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Manually recorded by counting the patients respiratory rate during one minute 2. Monitor (only if option 1 is not possible due to some interfering factor)

label: ed_sat
name: edsat
description: The first blood oxygen saturation level recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Recorded by project officer using an automatic peripheral pulse oximeter 2. Monitor (only if option 1 is not possible due to interfering factors such as intravenous lines, other attached equipment)
logic_prompts: "Blood oxygen saturation is quite high despite a low respiratory rate. Are you sure this is correct?","Blood oxygen saturation is quite high despite a low respiratory rate. Are you sure this is correct?"

label: ed_temperature
name: edt
description: The first temperature recorded when the patient arrives in the Emergency Department of participating centre
source: 1. Recorded by project officer using an thermometer

label: ed_pupils
name: edp
description: Pupilary response of the patient on arrival to the emergency department
source: Project Officer

label: ed_shock_index
name: edshi
description: Heart Rate divided by Systolic Blood Pressure recorded in the emergency department
source: Project Officer

label: ed_initial_serum_lactate
name: edisl
description: The first Serum lactate measured in the emergency department
source: Hospital record

label: ed_intial_be
name: ed_ini
description: The first BE measured in the emergency department
source: Hospital record

label: intubation
name: i
description: Indicates whether the patient was intubated after arriving to the emergency department
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: date_of_intubation
name: di
description: The date when the participant was first intubated after arriving to the emergency department
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_intubation
name: ti
description: The time when the participant was first intubated after arriving to the emergency department
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: chest_tube
name: ctu
description: Indicates whether a chest tube was inserted in the emergency department
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: date_of_chest_tube
name: dctu
description: The date when chest tube was inserted after arriving at the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_chest_tube
name: tctu
description: The time when chest tube was inserted after arriving at the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: vasopressors
name: vsp
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: date_of_vasopressors
name: dvsp
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_vasopressors
name: tvsp
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: num_transfusion_within_24h
name: nt24
description: Indicates the number of transfusions done within 24hrs of arrival to the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: fluids_within_24h
name: fl24
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: intervetion
name: int
description: Indicates any other interventions done within 24hrs of arrival to the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: date_of_injury
name: doi
description: The date when the participant was injured
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.
logic_prompts: "Date of injury cannot be after date of arrival"

label: time_of_injury
name: toi
description: The time when the participant was injured
source: 1. Participant 2. Participant relative/representative 3. Other person present who claim to know the participant 4. Hospital record
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: date_of_transport
name: dot
description: The date when the participant was transported from another hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_transport
name: tot
description: The time when the participant was transported from another hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: date_of_arrival
name: doa
description: The date when the participant arrived at the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_arrival
name: doa
description: The time when the participant arrived at the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: to_or
name: toor
description: Indicates whether the patient was transferred directly from the emergence department to the Operation theater
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant

label: date_of_surgery
name: dos
description: The date when the participant was first taken to operating room for surgery in the participating centre during the first 30 days of admission. Surgery is here defined as a surgical intervention performed under general or regional anaesthesia.
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format YYYY-MM-DD, where YYYY is a four digit year, MM a two digit month and DD a two digit day. If not available code as 999.

label: time_of_surgery
name: tos
description: The time when the participant was first taken to operating room for surgery in the participating centre during the first 30 days of admission. Surgery is here defined as a surgical intervention performed under general or regional anaesthesia.
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
coding_instructions: Code using the format HH:MM, where HH is a two digit hour and MM is a two digit minute. If not available code as 999.

label: admitted
name: ad
description: Indicates whether the patient was admitted in the hospital
source: 1. Direct observation by project officer 2. Hospital record 3. Participant 4. Participant relative 5. Other person present who claim to know the participant
